intro: Pedicularis karakorumiana, commonly known as the Karakorum lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, often at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are fleshy and often arranged in a rosette, while its stems are erect and branched. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
